text: William Ward Turney (July 11, 1861 - March 23, 1939) was a lawyer, rancher, state representative, and state senator in Texas.https://tshaonline.org/handbook/online/articles/ftu13 His former home now houses the International Museum of Art in El Paso. The residence was designed by Trost and Trost and built in 1908. Turney moved to El Paso in 1892. A Democrat, he served in the Texas legislature from 1893 until January 13, 1903. He had an impressive mustache. ==References== Category:1861 births Category:1939 deaths Category:Texas state senators Category:Texas Democrats Category:Texas lawyers Category:Ranchers from Texas Category:Members of the Texas House of Representatives
title: William Ward Turney
